abstract.text: Converts and permutes an ARGBFFFF image to an ARGB8888 image with dithering.
Converts and permutes an ARGBFFFF image to an ARGB8888 image with dithering.
Converts a four-channel ARGBFFFF image to a three-channel RGBFFF image by removing the alpha channel.
Separates an ARGBFFFF image into four Planar8 images.
Separates an ARGBFFFF image into four PlanarF images.
Converts an ARGBFFFF format image to an ARGB2101010 format image.
Converts an ARGBFFFF format image to an XRGB2101010 format image.
Converts an ARGB1555 image to an ARGB8888 image.
Converts an ARGB1555 image to an RGB565 image, with loss of alpha.
Separates an ARGB1555 image into four Planar8 images.
Converts an ARGB16U image to an RGB16U image.
Converts and permutes an ARGB16U image to an ARGB8888 image with dithering.
Converts an ARGB16U format image to an ARGB2101010 format image.
Converts an ARGB16U format image to an RGBA1010102 format image.
Converts an ARGB16U format image to an XRGB2101010 format image.
Converts and permutes an ARGB16U image to an ARGB8888 image.
Separates an ARGB16U image into four Planar16U images.
Converts an ARGB16Q12 format image to an ARGB2101010 format image.
Converts an ARGB16Q12 format image to an XRGB2101010 format image.
Converts an ARGB16Q12 format image to an RGBA1010102 format image.
Converts an ARGB2101010 format image to an ARGB16F format image.
Converts an ARGB2101010 format image to an ARGB16Q12 format image.
Converts an ARGB2101010 format image to an ARGB16U format image.
Converts an ARGB2101010 format image to an ARGB8888 format image.
Converts an ARGB2101010 format image to an ARGBFFFF format image.
Converts an ARGB8888 image into an ARGB1555 image.
Converts and permutes an ARGB8888 image into an RGB16U image.
Separates an ARGB8888 image into four Planar8 images.
Separates an ARGB8888 image into four PlanarF images.
Converts an ARGB8888 image into an RGB565 image.
Converts a four-channel ARGB8888 image to a three-channel RGB888 image by removing the alpha channel..
Separates an ARGB8888 image into four Planar16Q12 images.
Converts an ARGB8888 image to an ARGB1555 image with dithering.
Converts an ARGB8888 image to an RGB565 image with dithering.
Converts an ARGB8888 format image to an RGBA1010102 format image.
Converts an ARGB8888 format image to an ARGB2101010 format image.
Converts an ARGB8888 format image to an XRGB2101010 format image.
Converts and permutes an ARGB8888 image to an ARGB16U image.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to a vImage buffer structure that contains the source image whose data you want to convert.
A pointer to a vImage buffer data structure. You're responsible for filling out the
, and

fields of this structure, and for allocating a data buffer of the appropriate size. On return, the data buffer this structure points to contains the destination image data. When you no longer need the data buffer, you must deallocate the memory.
The encoding for 1.0 in the src buffer, full intensity. Typically, this is 1.0 for floating-point data in the range [0,1] but if your data is [0,65535], pass 65535.
A separate value is provided for each of the three channels.
The encoding for 0.0 in the src buffer, no light. Typically this is 0.0 for floating-point data in the range [0,1], but if your data is [-0.5,0.5], pass -0.5.
A separate value is provided for each of the three channels.
Type of dithering to apply to the image, if any.

An array of four 8-bit integers with the values 0, 1, 2, and 3, in some order. Each value specifies a channel from the source image that should be copied to that channel in the destination image. 0 denotes the alpha channel, 1 the red channel, 2 the green channel, and 3 the blue channel.
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
; otherwise, one of the error codes described in
This function supports the following dithering options:
This option applies no dithering. Input values are rounded to the nearest value representable in the destination format.

Precomputed blue noise is added to the image before the values are rounded to the destination format. The offset into the blue noise is randomized per call to avoid visible artifacts if you do your own tiling or call the function on sequential frames of video.

Precomputed blue noise is added to the image before the values are rounded to the destination format. The offset into the blue noise is the same for every call to allow users to get reproducible results.
Floyd-Steinberg dithering is applied to the image.
Atkinson dithering is applied to the image.
You can further influence the ordered dither methods by shaping the noise distribution using the Gaussian and uniform options below. These options are OR-ed with
or

When using an ordered dither pattern, distribute the noise according to a Gaussian distribution. This generally gives more pleasing images—less noisy and perhaps a little more saturated—but color fidelity can suffer. Its effect is between
and
. This option is the default for
and

When using an ordered dither pattern, distribute the noise uniformly. This generally gives the best color fidelity, but the resulting image is noisier and more obviously dithered. This is usually the best choice when low bit depth content is drawn next to high bit depth content and in other circumstances where subtle changes to color arising from the conversion could be easily noticed. It may be a poor choice when the image is likely to be enlarged—which would cause the noise to become more evident—and for very flat or synthetic content with little inherent noise. You can avoid the enlargement problem by enlarging first at high bit depth, then converting to lower bit depth.
